column5: Have a good Thanksgiving to all those celebrating the Canadian holiday. For our American friends, please join in.....crack open a "two-four", kick back and imagine a perfect world....beer in one hand (illegal) and a walleye on the line in the other (legal if you have a licence and it falls within legal size limits.....and if you are only using one line...and are not camping illegally in the green zone). Sometimes the simple pleasures are the best!
I bought some Blue for a shore lunch dinner my boat/cabin buddy are hosting Friday! Cheers!
Happy Thanksgiving to ya'llI can't wait for ours. Our new kitchen, in our new house will be done, my wife is a **** of cook, and I want some PECAN PIE!!!
Thanks for pointing that out.Kind of sounds like I should take tomorrow off and do some bow hunting,Gobble Gobble Gord!

Hey Gord, I left Little Vermilion Lake late yesterday afternoon after we had about 12" dumped on us. We were not into much about legal and illegal, but paid a lot of attention to nature's law. She rules. It's a pretty good way to live. Keep dry, warm and fed. I was prepared to stay another week, but weather isn't encouraging for fishing. Thanksgiving is being ruined for a lot of moose. Happy Thanksgiving for all you guys up there.
What, a little snow sent you packing? I agree, mother nature rules.......that's why they invented beer........
